div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 08:55 am CDT

div.div: Showers, with thunderstorms also possible after 1pm. High near 65. North wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
Isolated sprinkles before 9pm. Partly cloudy, with a low around 41. North wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.
A 20 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms after 1pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 67. Northwest wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

h3.a: CCHS Registration Handbook and Scheduling Worksheet

div.p:
CCHS Students and Parents,
You may click on the links below to view the CCHS Registration Handbook and the Scheduling Worksheet.
The Registration Handbook will open in a new browser window as a PDF and the Scheduling Worksheet will download as a word document.
CCHS Registration Handbook
Scheduling Worksheet
Please contact Mrs. Anderson at danderson@centralcityps.org with any questions.

div.p:
Central City High School Career and College Fair - Learn to Earn
On December 20th, Central City High School hosted their twelfth annual Career and College Fair called Learn to Earn. The Fair went well and was described by CCHS students as educational, fun, informative, and well put together. Over forty guest presenters, representatives, and recruiters volunteered their time and knowledge to the students during the Career and . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about College Career Day

h3.a: CCHS National Honor Society Trip to Henry Doorly Zoo

div.p: CCHS NHS had an educational and beautiful day at Henry Doorly Zoo! We started out with an interesting behind the scenes tour of the aquarium! Then we were able to see the other exhibits.

a.aria-label: Read more about CCHS National Honor Society Trip to Henry Doorly Zoo

div.p: On September 26, 2019, twenty-two additional juniors and seniors were recognized for scholarship, leadership, service and character while in high school when they were inducted into the Central City High School Chapter of National Honor Society (NHS). These outstanding students became part of a tradition that has existed since 1925. Mrs. Doris Gacke played beautiful piano music before the program. Mr. . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about CCHS National Honor Society Induction
